title.value: An Empirical Study of Data Access Self-Admitted Technical Debt
title.justification: The title directly mentions the focus on empirical research on Data Access Self-Admitted Technical Debt.
title.quote: An Empirical Study of Data Access Self-Admitted Technical Debt

extractions.description: This paper presents a large-scale empirical study focusing on self-admitted technical debt (SATD) in data-intensive systems. The research analyzes 83 SQL-based and 19 NoSQL-based open-source systems to understand the prevalence, composition, and evolution of SATD, especially in data-access logic, and presents new categories of SATD in this context.

type.justification: The study involves a large-scale empirical analysis of several open-source data-intensive systems to investigate self-admitted technical debt.
type.quote: We present a large-scale empirical study on the prevalence, composition, and evolution of SATD in data-intensive systems.

name.justification: The study focuses on technical debt, a key concern in the field of software engineering, particularly in the context of data-intensive systems.
name.quote: Data-intensive systems, however, have several peculiarities posing challenges to software engineering practitioners and researchers.

name.justification: The paper specifically examines technical debt within data-intensive systems, focusing on data-access logic and interactions with relational and NoSQL databases.
name.quote: We present a large-scale empirical study on the prevalence, composition, and evolution of SATD in data-intensive systems.

name.justification: The core of the study is around self-admitted technical debt, exploring its prevalence, persistence, and composition in software systems.
name.quote: Understanding the composition and distribution of the SATDs across software systems and their evolution could provide insights into managing technical debt efficiently.

name.justification: The library is used in the study to extract comments from source code as part of the SATD detection process.
name.quote: SATD detection was carried out in two phases. In the first phase, we extracted the comments of each snapshot of all the projects using srcML.

referenced_paper_title.value: srcML: An infrastructure for the exploration, analysis, and manipulation of source code: A tool demonstration
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to srcML connects to its ability to transform source code into an XML format, facilitating further analysis.
